intro: Veronica alpiphila, commonly known as the alpine speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in high-altitude environments. Veronica alpiphila is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging ecological conditions.
